text: United States gubernatorial elections were held in 1933, in the state of Virginia. Virginia holds its gubernatorial elections in odd numbered years, every 4 years, following the United States presidential election year. == Results == {| class="wikitable" |- ! State !! Incumbent !! Party !! Status !! Opposing Candidates |- | Virginia || bgcolor="lightgrey"| John Garland Pollard || Democratic || Term-limited, Democratic victory || George Campbell Peery (Democratic) 73.74% Fred W. McWane (Republican) 24.24% Andrew J. Dunning (Prohibition) 0.67% George C. White (Socialist) 0.67% John Moffett Robinson (Independent) 0.53% W. A. Rowe (Independent) 0.16% |} ==References== Category:November 1933 events
title: 1933 United States gubernatorial elections
